stimulusHtml: In the short run, which of the following must be true for a perfectly competitive firm that is maximizing profits?
choicesHtml: The firm will shut down if it has any economic losses.
The firm will produce at the minimum of average total cost.
The firm will produce where MR = MC, but price from the demand curve is greater than MC.
The firm will produce where MR = MC as long as P is greater than average variable cost.
The firm will produce the quantity that exhibits allocative and productive efficiency.
